snippet: Subspecies of the flowers share most of their genes, but differ in a handful that lead to some being yellow on magenta and others being magenta on yellow.

headline.main: How Snapdragons Beckon Bees With More Than One Color
headline.print_headline: Mirror Images: Snapdragon Blooms, In Kaleidoscope Hues

snippet: North Korea’s founding myths trace back to the country’s rugged peaks, but those mountains also play a pivotal role in the Kim dynasty’s rule.

headline.main: How North Korea’s Mountains Protect the Kim Dynasty’s Power

Accelerating glacial melt in the Andes caused by climate change has set off a gold rush downstream, letting the desert bloom. But as the ice vanishes, the vast farms below may do the same.

headline.main: In Peru’s Deserts, Melting Glaciers Are a Godsend (Until They’re Gone)
headline.print_headline: Living Off a Glacier, While It Lasts

snippet: An upstate New York railroad operator is storing unused cars, some of which carried oil, on tracks in the forest. Environmental groups oppose the move.

headline.main: Empty Rail Cars Roll Into the Adirondacks, Stirring Controversy
